section.title: Modifying the palette
section.para: The palette is described in OpenMath with some special symbols in a private CD describing the palette-rows palette-entries and input-boxes.
If is furthermore possible to select the palette using javascript:
section.programlisting:
<script type='text/javascript' src='org/mathdox/formulaeditor/main.js'>
  </script>
  <script type='text/javascript'>
    if (org) {
      alert("org already defined, could not set options");
    } else {
      var org = { mathdox: { formulaeditor: { options: {
        fontSize: 300,
        paletteURL : "palette_tabbed.xml"
      }}}};
    }
   </script>
section.para: In MathDox this can also be done by adding an mathdox:options attribute to the xforms:textarea-element.
The palette can be made draggable with dragPalette:true. The total listing now becomes:
section.programlisting: <xforms:textarea ref='formula' class='math-editor' mathdox:options='{ dragPalette:true, fontSize: 300, paletteURL : "palette_tabbed.xml" }' />
